item.title: [GLOBAL][Databases] - MongoDB migration
item.description:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Jul 17, 11:54 UTC  -  Jul 28, 11:54 UTC

May 23, 07:12 UTC
Scheduled - Start time : 17/07/2023 11:54 UTC
End time : 28/07/2023 11:54 UTC
Service impact : A small downtime may be experienced for less than 15 minutes.
Service improvement : As part of our continuous improvement policy of our services, we will be doing a migration for our MongoDB nodes.

item.title: [GRA5/GRA7/GRA9/SBG5/WAW1/SGP1/BHS5/SYD1/DE1/UK1/VA1/OR1][Public cloud] - End of life for Kubernetes 1.21
item.description:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Jul 4, 06:00 UTC  -  Jul 6, 17:00 UTC

Jun 6, 10:39 UTC
Update - An email has been sent to customers identified. It states that this maintenance is scheduled for 22/06/2023.
This was an error and we apologize.
The actual window is defined by this public task and is between the 04 and the 06 of July.

May 17, 02:49 UTC
Scheduled - Start time : 04/07/2023 06:00 UTC
End time : 06/07/2023 17:00 UTC
Service impact : No impact except for the apps that do not support the new version (1.22).
Service improvement : The aim of this maintenance is to upgrade deprecated clusters to a supported newer version (1.22).

item.title: [EU/CA][LogsDataPlatform] - Protocol migration
item.description:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Jun 14, 10:00 - 13:00 UTC

Apr 15, 01:44 UTC
Scheduled - Start time : 14/06/2023 10:00 UTC
End time : 14/06/2023 13:00 UTC
Service impact : None
Service improvement :Following our continuous improvement policy, we will perfom an maintenance on LDP.

item.title: [GLOBAL][ManagedKubernetesService] Managed nodes OS upgrades for clusters in "Do not update" and "Minimum unavailability" policy update configuration
item.description:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Jun 13, 08:30 UTC  -  Jun 15, 16:00 UTC

Apr 13, 12:53 UTC
Scheduled - Start time : 13/06/2023 08:30 UTC
End time : 15/06/2023 16:00 UTC
Service impact : No impact is expected but you should have enough nodes in your K8S cluster to allow a rolling upgrade of them and to absorb a rescheduling of your workload without downtime.
Service improvement : As part of our continuous improvement policy of our services, we will upgrade all public cloud instances (a.k.a. nodes) managed by the MKS team and running in your Kubernetes clusters to upgrade them from the operating system Ubuntu 18.04.06 LTS version to the Ubuntu 22.04.02 LTS version.
Clusters with an upgrade policy set to "Do not update / NEVER_UPDATE" and "Minimum unavailability / MINIMAL_DOWNTIME" are targeted by this maintenance.
To prevent non wanted upgrade on MKS services, we leave it up to the customers more time to manage this upgrade by themselves.
But, as the Ubuntu 18.04 LTS support will be disabled on the 31/05/2023, be aware that in case of critical vulnerability, we kept the right to force upgrade impacted services to patch as soon as possible vulnerable managed control planes and nodes.

item.title: [EU/UK][Public Cloud] - Cloud Databases
item.description:
Jun 6, 10:03 UTC
Resolved - Start time : 19/05/2023 22:00 UTC
End Time : 06/06/2023 10:00 UTC
Our technical teams resolved the issue. All impacted services are now operational.

Jun 1, 08:41 UTC
Identified - Start time : 19/05/2023 22:00 UTC
Service impact : Database services are healthy and backed up. However, some secondary backup on Cassandra, M3, MySQL, PostgreSQL, Redis and OpenSearch engines may take time to synchronise in remote location.
Root cause : Synchronisation automation fall in inconsistent state due to an software issue.
Ongoing actions : Implementing a fix

item.title: [US][PublicCloud] - Keystone API
item.description:
Jun 5, 10:02 UTC
Resolved - Start time : 05/06/2023 09:35 UTC
End Time : 05/06/2023 09:59 UTC
Our technical teams resolved the issue. All impacted services are now operational.

Jun 5, 10:01 UTC
Update - further investigation reported impact on us-west-va.
Service impact : KeyStone API is not responsive. You might experience some error code 403 ("forbidden").

Jun 5, 09:50 UTC
Investigating - Start time : 05/06/2023 09:35 UTC
Service impact : KeyStone API is not responsive.
Ongoing actions : Investigating
Our technical teams are working on the issue.
update will be post as significant progress is made.
